item.title: Talk about TypeScript's interface
item.description: ““Call it a duck if it looks like one.” Interface is used to define the shape or structure of an object.

item.title: Talk about etcd (Part3): the Communication Protocol between Client and Server
item.description: As mentioned earlier, etcd implements each module through layers. This time we will enter the network part. Today, let’s talk about the communication way of etcd inside the server and client role.

item.title: Talk about etcd (Part2): the raft consistency protocol
item.description:
The purpose of the consensus algorithm is to maintain a consensus conclusion when there is an abnormality in the machine cluster to ensure the provision of services to the outside world.

Today, let’s talk about the consensus mechanism of etcd, the raft protocol.

item.title: Talk about etcd (Part1): Hierarchy Overview with bird's eye view
item.description: etcd is very common in the field of microservices. This series will talk about what problems etcd solves and how it solves it for a step-by-step analysis.

item.title: Talk about Go: A high performance pool for reusing object - Sync.Pool
item.description: Pooling is frequently occurring in software field, such as connection pool\thread pool\routine poool etc. A pool is essentially to reuse resources.

item.title: Talk about Go: Goroutine's information and how to prevent goroutine leaks
item.description: Goroutines are a common concept in Go, which starts and ends with the life cycle of a go program. Today, let’s talk about Go’s goroutine leak.

item.title: Talk about Go: A simple implement of Circuit Breaker
item.description: A simple implement of circuit breaker with Go, trigger for fail-fast and return quickly when your API comes to high error rate durning a period of time. It’s a protection strategy that prevents the upstream from retrying repeatedly so that the downstream is overwhelmed.

item.title: Talk about Go: Network programming about grouping and unpacking in TCP flow
item.description: As we all know, packet body transmission is an import part of network communication, whether it is the header or body of HTTP packets at the application layer, or the streaming data of TCP at the transport layer.

item.title: Talk about Go: The gracefully handling of service restart
item.description: Last time we talked about graceful shutdown of Go programs, today we will talk about graceful restarts.

item.title: Talk about Go: The gracefully handling of service shutdown
item.description: From high availability to graceful shutdown/restart, to refinement to program offline/restart, etc. So what can we do in Go? Today let’s talk about the graceful shutdown of go programs.

item.title: Talk about Go: How to custom build a gateway interceptor in Gin framwork
item.description: Middleware often used as a level “security check”, for core components such as request header/request body verification, caching, and current limiting.

item.title: Before talking about the Gin web framework, let's take a look at httprouter
item.description: The etymology of Gin a strong alcohol, comes from the Netherlands.

item.title: 聊一聊Go实现的多协程下载器: gopeed-core
item.description: 之前在Github社区偶然发现一个Go实现的下载器，作为个人学习的一个参照模板，这里要感谢一下作者monkeyWie(网名)的开源项目gopeed-core。

item.title: Talk about Go: Network programming--TCP Connection Management
item.description: In the last article, we talked about how to initiate a TCP connection in Go, and listed a full-duplex demo. Today, we will talk about connection pool management further.

item.title: Talk about Go: Network programming--TCP Communication
item.description: In the seven-layer protocol of network layering, we know that TCP is below the HTTP layer. In essence, the HTTP packet body parsing is established based on the underlying TCP connection.

item.description: 不要通过共享内存来通信(互斥锁同步)，而要用通信来共享内存。

item.title: Talk about Go: The operating system's thread scheduling and Goroutines
item.description: Every task running on our computer is resource allocation at the operating system level. From starting a process to creating a thread, with a fixed number of cores, multiple threads execute concurrently.
